data.title: [WelcomeUX] Welcome page should have a max width
data.body:
Testing #18091

Welcome page should be constraints and centered on windows that are very wide. Something like using 1000px maximum or something should make it look more attractive.

Current:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/22159949/262d9f70-def8-11e6-9adc-34ebaf188a68.png)

Proposed:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/22159987/4e900cb4-def8-11e6-96b2-b131efc3e239.png)

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Could not resolve any model with uri 'javascript:void%280%29'
data.body:
Testing #18091

When I click an item in 'Recent', I notice an error message box appear at the top of the screen for an instant before disappearing when the window reloads. So I open the devtools console and check the 'Preserve log' option. Next time I open something in Recent I see these errors:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/22159094/3ff776a0-def4-11e6-90a2-030ff69f1b94.png)

data.title: Paste not working correctly in Terminal

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Calculate linux (Gentoo)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Integrated Terminal in VSCode
2. type "history" (this may not be necessary, but I tried to copy a previous command I executed)
3. Select long, wrapped text from terminal which spans to multiple lines, right click then Copy
4. Next to the curost, Right click and Paste the text to the terminal
5. Only the "first line" in the wrapped text is pasted

I'm using bash shell.

data.title: Command Line: -r option doesn't work ?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (f9e19d80f342779b49386fcf37b89387b3c353ac, 2017-01-20T07:12:07.780Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15007
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.2|
|theme-dracula|dracula-theme|1.2.5|
|vscode-great-icons|emmanuelbeziat|1.1.38|
|Theme-azure|gerane|0.0.2|
|theme-material-theme|jprestidge|1.0.1|
|vs-color-picker|lihui|0.3.2|
|Theme-MaterialKit|ms-vscode|0.1.1|
|view-in-browser|qinjia|0.0.4|
|ActiveFileInStatusBar|RoscoP|1.0.2|
|eval|Stormspirit|0.0.5|
|omnipascal|Wosi|0.12.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. run vscode and open a folder
2. from the command line, type "code -r file" (file

What happens:
A new code window is opened

What should happen:
The last active window should be used instead

data.title: TypeScript confused?
data.body:
Often, unsure when and how, I find TypeScript being very confused. For instance, below screen shots show it not knowing `lib.d.ts` anymore. I have no repo steps, but my suspect is 'large' git operations, like switching branches.

![screen shot 2017-01-20 at 15 43 28](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1794099/22153355/4a5c64ba-df27-11e6-9f4e-9b5796ea9372.png)
![screen shot 2017-01-20 at 15 43 39](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1794099/22153354/4a3e6564-df27-11e6-90ce-20a9dbc99bbc.png)

data.title: Undo last commit action
data.body: There is no undo last commit action at the moment. I use it daily and have grown fond of it

data.title: Stage selected lines missing
data.body: There is no stage selected lines action at the moment. I use it daily and have grown fond of it
